snippet: Mo Yan, the new Nobel laureate, stepped into a political minefield over Liu Xiaobo, 2010’s peace prize winner.
abstract: New Nobel laureate Mo Yan, who avoided antagonizing China's Communist Party during much of his literary career, steps into political minefield by calling for release of imprisoned writer and fellow Nobel winner Liu Xiaobo, who is serving an 11-year sentence for subversion.

byline.contributor: Edward Wong contributed reporting. Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Mo Yan, the new Nobel laureate, stepped into a political minefield over Liu Xiaobo, 2010’s peace prize winner.

headline.seo: Mo Yan Calls for Fellow Nobel Laureate’s Freedom
headline.main: Chinese Nobel Winner Calls for Dissident’s Release
headline.print_headline: Chinese Nobel Laureate Calls for His Nation to Free Another
